title: Rito have lost it.
body:
So i don't know how many of you actually know Tyler1, but he is a somewhat toxic player (no more toxic than some of the pros.), that has recently actually been making steps to improve his behaviour in game and is a increasingly popular league streamer (or was) that is a draven 1 trick.

Well he just got perma-banned.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/8a75KeUR-the-indefinite-banning-of-tyler1

Gotta love riot and their inability to make sense ever.

Good to know Kaceytron etc. still exist though.

replies.body:
i was gonna start watching his stream cos i never knew how much i wanted to watch a...."decent" draven. watching a draven snowball so fast in combination with all the young toxic trolls finding a haven to gather to, are probably sufficient reasons for his surge of popularity. 

but its best for the community that he doesnt "enable" his younger audience by pretty much encouraging the worst, most toxic behaviour in league

insulting people and being an asshole
disregarding teammates, treating them with no respect
feeling like you need to carry, and doing what you can to do so (taking blue as an adc, more so a problem for a draven, announcing alleged ks's)
instalocking the only champ you'll play, will probably troll/feed in the lobby/game if you dont get your pick 
feeding when things arent going your way
feeding when things are going your way, but then 1 thing doesnt
probably a lot more

I mean for a guy who boasts about having 17 permabanned accounts, i don't feel sorry for him at all, he is an obvious douche.

HOWEVER the only reason they go to such lengths is because he got famous. Had this toxic piece of garbage continued to be himself and NOT stream, he would last in the community for years.

>Had this toxic piece of garbage continued to be himself and NOT stream, he would last in the community for years.

Kaceytron is still here.

yeah but kaceytron isn't ruining high elo games by intentionally feeding when the corki mid takes blue.

I feel like you have never watched Kaceytron if your trying to defend this point.

The only decent point you have is the bit saying high elo, but that is just stupid that someone should be banned because they are good at the game with the same attitude.

they both should be banned for sure, but there are significant differences between them.

Really?

The main difference being kacey trolls everyone, whereas Tyler doesn't, and hasn't trolled recently?

Or are we still talking about the elo difference?

Thank god his perma banned he deserved it 110%. who cares if his becoming a better person, huh did i just say that thought i never would maybe i take it back cause it isn't true he was toxic back then he still is now so how about you stop posting bull shit like this and blame riot for everything, he deserved it!
I'm sorry, could you say that in English without contradicting yourself a billion times over? Would make it just that little bit easier to understand your point.

> [{quoted}](name=EzeBlood,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=a4BPE4mh,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-05-03T07:58:01.024+0000)
>
> I'm sorry, could you say that in English without contradicting yourself a billion times over? Would make it just that little bit easier to understand your point.

Clearly people that follow Tyler 1 is retarded and clearly you come under the people who follow I'm guessing. if you don't know what i mean by he deserved it 110% which is metaphorically saying that he deserved it more then what other people think, his latest video that someone sent me showed him saying he has been toxic and doing this for over 5 years so he knew it was coming sooner or later. 
and i was being sarcastic about him becoming a better man what people call "Reforming" but he was always toxic and never will never get out of that mood after 5 years.
Also Jazza has always gone against riot and blamed and cried about everything and anything that has come up and I'm sick of seeing it for example his now complaining about the support team.

Tell me if you don't understand any of this clearly!

It was more a callout on your grammar and the fact that your contradictions were able to be seen far and wide. Now, you've just made it (your grammar) worse. When posting on a public forum, you should always use correct grammar, otherwise conversations like this can become a one way argument where I completely roast your ass with politics and tertiary education.

riot doesn't want to admit it's their own game that creates all this toxicity. their shitty meta, their shitty dynamic queue, their shitty matchmaking system, their shitty elo system just to name a few. they should focus on fixing those, not banning someone who is a popular entertainer. but hey its costs a lot less (basically free) to throw out some bans than to actually develop the game in ways that doesn't directly involve a return in income. "oh hey guys riot has your back". get out.

furthermore, if they want to consider this piece of shit game a "sport" then they need to accept that shit talking comes with it. as tyler1 correctly points out, THERE IS A MUTE BUTTON. someone shouldn't be getting banned for using "bad words" or shit talking (the only exception may be legitimate death threats). that should be reserved for things like afking/intent feeding and of course cheating/hacking.

of course salty kids will hit the report button because they got shit talked if the option is there to do so. in other legitimate sports you can't report players to the referee or the executives for "calling me a shit %%%%" or "he called me fucking terrible". you have 2 options. mute (in real life you ignore) or talk shit back.

> the only exception may be death threats

Remembers Dunkey...
It's getting like 20 downvotes a minute atm from what i have seen.

Okay so they ban Tyler1...


but Graves can't have a cigar.
